  • Method Details

    • getBestMove

      public int getBestMove(Color[][] board, int depth)
      Calculates the best move possible with the given depth, based on the minimax algorithm and alpha-beta pruning
      Parameters:
      board - The board it gets as a starting point
      depth - The amount of times it will go through the algorithm
      Returns:
      The column it deemes best
      See Also:
      • minimax(Color[][], int, int, int, boolean)
      • copyBoard(Color[][])
      • Game.getCurrentY(Color[][], int)
      • checkWin(Color[][], Color)

    • minimax

      private int minimax(Color[][] board, int depth, int alpha, int beta, boolean maximizing)
      Calculates a score for a series of moves If the
      Parameters:
      board - The board the AI is doing the search in
      depth - Depth of the search
      alpha - AI's best score so far - for pruning
      beta - Human's best score so far - for pruning
      maximizing - If true, it uses the AI part of the algorithm and then sends it into the human part. If false, it uses the human part of the algorithm and then sends it into the AI part.
      Returns:
      The best score for the current board state
      See Also:
      • makeMove(Color[][], int, Color)
      • getWinner(Color[][])
      • Game.isBoardFull(Color[][])
      • Game.isColumnAvailable(Color[][], int)

    • getWinner

      private Color getWinner(Color[][] board)
      Scours the board to see if either color can win anywhere
      Parameters:
      board - The board in which the checking happens
      Returns:
      The color that can win in the next move

    • checkWin

      private boolean checkWin(Color[][] board, Color player)
      Parameters:
      board - The board on which the check will run on
      player - The color of the player it checks
      Returns:
      If the winner is YELLOW it returns true, false otherwise
      See Also:
      • getWinner(Color[][])

    • evaluateWindow

      private int evaluateWindow(Color[][] board, int col, int row, int dCol, int dRow, Color player)
      Calculates a score, based on how many coins are lined up and what color they have
      Parameters:
      board - The board the function works with
      col - The starting column
      row - The starting row
      dCol - The direction it will move in, in the column section
      dRow - The direction it will move in, in the row section
      player - The color of the player that the function will calculate for
      Returns:
      The score

      Parameters:

      col - The column it will place a coin in
      player - The color of the coin
      Returns:
